args:
The prince and his party retrieve the treasure
from Barbary, then commit to fully enjoying
the rest of their island summer. But then Siren
asks the group to construct her a stage where
people can gather for a concert!
Yar, I be surrenderin', says I!
Here, take the bedamned thing!\nMay ye never have a day's luck with it.
This is it. This is Simon's treasure.
Do you see me now, old friend?\nI finally have it back.
Gar, ye landlubbers got what ye wanted,\nso at least spare me life!
Who do you think we are?! To slay a\nhelpless enemy is an inexcusable sin!
Aye, but ye be merciful, preacher!
Guess I'll be takin' me leave, then...
AHEM! ...I think there's something\nyou still need to do?
I gave ye the blasted treasure already!
And what about the island? The whole\nplace is in shambles because of you.
You're not leaving until every last stone\nis put back in its proper place.
I ain't no deck-swabbin' cabin girl!\nI be a PIRATE!
Then get your minions to help you.
A fine idea. Much of this trouble can\nbe laid at their feet, after all.
Now get in line, all of you!\nAnd let's make it orderly!
Yar, I know when I be beat...\nGet to work, ye scurvy dogs!

And with that, the struggle over Simon's lost
treasure came to a close. And thanks to Estelle's
strict instruction, Barbary and her minions
returned the island to pristine condition.
Now the prince and his friends intend to enjoy\nthe rest of summer to the fullest on the\nisland's lovely beach...
So THIS is what all the fuss was about!
I'm sorry I wasn't of more help to you\nwhen it mattered most.
Don't worry about it—I know you had\nyour own work to deal with.
Besides, you were plenty of help!
Your fortune gave me the hint I needed \nto figure out how to fight Barbary!

That buxom lass be a fortune teller?
Yar, what I wouldn't give for some'a
that talent—I could get me mitts on all
the treasure in the world! Gahar har har!
It sounds like someone needs\nmore instruction!
I'm sorry, cap'n! Don't instruct me more!
You clearly have a long way to go\nbefore you are reformed...
Heh. Sounds like you have a\npretty big job ahead of you.
Yep! I'm not leaving this island until\nI've whipped Barbary into shape.

I shall assist you in this endeavor.
Should she return to the high seas
without proper reformation, all ships
would surely be in jeopardy.
Now THAT'S a pair what'll strike fear\ninto troublemakers everywhere.
Brrr! No thanks. I'm gonna beat it outta\nhere before I end up makin' 'em angry.
If you don't get up to any mischief,\nI won't have to get angry!
Good luck, Estelle. I know you'll have\nBarbary whipped into shape in no time.
It may take some time, but I WILL see it\nthrough to the end. You may expect me\nback at the castle once the work is done.
I'll be looking forward to it.
There you are! {player_name}!\nDo you have a second or whatever?
Ya here to hang with us humans for a bit?
If so, you are more than welcome.\nYou are the main reason for our\nvictory, after all.
We should go play some volleyball and\nthen stuff our faces with barbecue!
But I actually had a question for you.
I did a great job the other day, right?\nI mean, I was helpful and stuff?
Okay, because I have a teeeeny tiiiiny\nlittle request for you...
Just name it and it's yours.\n...Er, within reason.
I want you to build me a humongous stage\nand then invite everybody you know to\nshow up for my comeback concert!
Siren's request clearly came from the heart.\nBut could the prince and his friends possibly\nmake it come true...?
This hot summer isn't over yet!
